intro: Pleurophora patagonica, commonly known as the Patagonian pleurophora, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its flowers are usually white or pale green. Pleurophora patagonica is notable for its ecological role in supporting local pollinators and its potential use in traditional medicine.
